titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for Harold C. Green diary, 1918-1919.
titlestmt.author: Collection processed and finding aid created by Sarah Gurnick

publicationstmt.publisher: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created by Sarah Gurnick 2008
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using Describing Archives: A Content Standard (DACS)

change.item: Original encoding from Word 2000 file using Word macros and Xmetal.

titlepage.publisher:
Michigan Historical Collections
Bentley Historical Library
University of Michigan
titlepage.titleproper:
Finding aid for
Harold C. Green Diary, 1918-1919.
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Sarah Gurnick, 2008

did.abstract: Harold Green was a Mount Clemens, Michigan, optometrist who served with the U.S. Army 339th Medical Detachment during the American intervention at Archangel, Russia. This collection contains a typescript copy of his diary, containing generally brief entries describing his actions in Russia.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Donald W. Green, of Clinton Township, Michigan, in 2007 (Donor No. 9959).

accruals.p: No further additions to the collection are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

prefercite.p: Harold C. Green diary, 1918-1919, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: An optometrist from Mount Clemens, Michigan who served with the U.S. Army 339th Medical Detachment during the American intervention at Archangel, Russia.

scopecontent.p: Diary and typescript containing generally brief entries describing his actions in Russia; also, photographs.
